Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Paul Chun committed contempt of court by selling counterfeit Louis Vuitton products after a court order prohibited such sales
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court Rules, Canadian trademark and contempt laws
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Contempt hearing following a show cause order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Witness testimonies, photographic evidence, and admission of knowledge of the order
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Chun acknowledged the order and shrugged when confronted, indicating awareness and disregard
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Contempt of court requires disobedience of a valid court order with knowledge and willfulness
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Acknowledged receipt of order; no denial of activity
Crimes.Outcome: Fined $50,000 and ordered to pay $35,000 in costs; potential imprisonment if unpaid
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial hearing on show cause order
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Anton Piller order, inherent jurisdiction of court over contempt
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Contempt rules regarding compliance with injunctions

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Paul Chun knowingly disobeyed a court order prohibiting sale of counterfeit goods
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court Act, principles of civil contempt
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Clear evidence of post-order sales at night market and from van
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Chun admitted knowledge of the order and did not dispute the sales
Crimes.Legal_Rule: A person is guilty of contempt if they knowingly disobey a court order
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: De novo for findings of fact and law in contempt matters
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Common law and Federal Court practice
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No defense raised; acknowledgment of order
Crimes.Outcome: $50,000 fine and $35,000 in costs; possible 60-day imprisonment if unpaid
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Punitive fine and compensation for enforcement costs
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Inherent power of court to punish contempt
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Show cause order leading to summary contempt finding
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Willful disobedience of court order constitutes contempt

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Paul Chun violated trademark rights through unauthorized sale of counterfeit Louis Vuitton goods
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Liability established via contempt for breach of injunction against infringement
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (civil standard), elevated to criminal standard due to contempt
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Chun’s failure to comply despite clear notice
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Selling goods bearing registered trademarks without authorization infringes trademark rights
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Beyond a reasonable doubt (due to contempt context)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized use of Louis Vuitton trademarks on counterfeit goods
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian Trademark Law and equitable remedies
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Preventing ongoing infringement and enforcing court orders
Crimes.Court_Result: Finding of liability through contempt mechanism
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 19, 20, and 38 of the Trademarks Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized reproduction and sale of protected marks
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Anton Piller order followed by contempt hearing
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Trademark owners have exclusive rights to use and license their marks
